abstract: Two unions including Communications Workers of America, representing 36,000 Verizon workers in eastern United States, set strike deadline in what would be one of biggest strikes in years; scant progress has been achieved in eight months of talks.
lead_paragraph: The unions, representing employees in the East, say they have made little progress with management in the eight months since their contracts expired.

headline.main: Two Unions Set Strike Deadline for 36,000 Verizon Workers
headline.print_headline: Two Unions Set Wednesday Strike Deadline for 36,000 Verizon Workers in the East

snippet: The unions, representing employees in the East, say they have made little progress with management in the eight months since their contracts expired.
